title: Edit a TikTok Caption after Posting (And What to Do If You Can’t)

steps.title: Open the video you want to edit.
steps.content: Open the video you want to edit. If you made a typo in your caption or just want to change what you wrote, you can now edit your captions after posting on TikTok. You can only edit a caption if it's been fewer than 7 days since you posted the video. You'll only be able to edit your caption once a day.

steps.title: Tap the three dots ••• .
steps.content: Tap the three dots ••• . You'll see this at the bottom-right corner of the video.

steps.title: Scroll right and tap Edit post.
steps.content: Scroll right and tap Edit post . It's toward the end of the menu at the bottom of the screen. This opens a helpful editor that allows you to edit parts of your TikTok post after posting it.

steps.title: Edit your caption and tap Save.
steps.content: Edit your caption and tap Save . In addition to editing the caption, you can add or change hashtags , mentions, your location, and even your cover image.

steps.title: The "Edit post" option is only available if it's been less than 7 days since you made your post.
steps.content: The "Edit post" option is only available if it's been less than 7 days since you made your post. If you don't see "Edit post" after tapping the three dots on your video, this may be why.

steps.title: If you already edited the post once today, you can't edit it again.
steps.content: If you already edited the post once today, you can't edit it again. Captions, cover images, and other editable content can only be edited once per day.

steps.title: The post may be too new.
steps.content: The post may be too new. If you just posted a video, you may not see the option to edit the caption until it's been fully uploaded to TikTok. Give TikTok a few moments to finish processing your video and try again later.

steps.title: You might need to update the app.
steps.content: You might need to update the app. If it's been a while since you updated TikTok on your Android , iPhone, or iPad , check for and install updates to make sure you have the "Edit post" option.
